Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.2: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.3: SUPPORT FACILITY OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique number that allows eachsupport facility to be associated with well operations more than once, such as timeswhen a rig will go on and off site, depending on the well site construction schedule.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: DEPTH DATUM: The point from which all depths are measured. For example: kellybushing, ground level, barge floor
Column Comment.6: DEPTH DATUM ELEVATION: Operator reported elevation of the measurementdatum used as a reference for other measured well points.
Column Comment.8: DERRICK FLOOR ELEVATION: For elevations that are reported from the Derrickfloor.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.11: ELEVATION REFERENCE DATUM: the name of the datum to which elevations arereferenced e.g. MSL or LAT.
Column Comment.12: ENVIRONMENT TYPE: the environment in which operations occur or data iscollected (marine, land, transition)
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.14: KELLY BUSHING ELEVATION: The elevation of the kelly bushing (generallymeasured from sea level)
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.18: RIG ON SITE DATE: The date that the drilling rig is moved onto the well site.
Column Comment.19: RIG RELEASE DATE: Date the drilling rig can be released from operations andmoved from the well site as specified in the contract.
Column Comment.20: ROTARY TABLE ELEV: The elevation of the rotary table. This is needed to trackAustrailian information.
Column Comment.22: WELL SUPPORT FACILITY USE TYPE: The type of use that a support facility is putto for a particular well, such as access, drilling, communications etc.
Column Comment.23: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.24: SUBSEA REFERENCE ELEVATION TYPE: The reported type of elevation that wasused to determine the subsea elevation, such as Kelly Bushing, Driller Floor, CasingFlange, Rotary Table etc. The Subsea elevation is computed by subtracting theground elevation from the elevation reported by the drilling contractor.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
